intro: Hugonia neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonian starling plant, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
